newsitem.title: UK: BLENHEIM UP ON REED BID TALK.
newsitem.headline: BLENHEIM UP ON REED BID TALK.

text.p: Shares in Blenheim Group jumped on a report that a 450 million stg bid from publisher Reed-Elsevier is forthcoming, traders said.

The Independent newspaper, quoting an unnamed source close to Reed, said the Anglo-Dutch publisher is preparing an offer of about 480p per share. The newspaper also quoted a source close to Blenheim as saying Reed was not the only bidder.
At 1146 GMT, Blenheim shares were quoted at 433p, up from a previous close of 413-1/2p.
Traders said the shares didn't rise more because takeover speculation surrounding Blenheim has been in the market for months.

"There were a lot of people who got their fingers burnt on the last takover rumours, and I don't think they want to get involved again, said one market maker. "They're perfectly happy to sit on the sidelines."
The company was not immediately available for comment.
